intro: Cheiranthus callosus, commonly known as the rough wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other garden and wild plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small, yellow or orange, and appear in clusters, often blooming in late winter or early spring. The leaves are hairy and have a rough texture, giving the plant its common name.
